thig15.1:43.3:
The term Mahilā only appears twice In the Pāli Canon. It has been translated as 'woman', from the similar Sanskrit word that has this meaning.   

I translate the mahilā as honored, by taking this word ‘maha,’ worthiness, with the suffix -lā to convey perhaps female and male, or “mahita” honored….. which would make sense due to the status of slave.
